result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Misappropriate Buyer Prepayments Under Home Improvement Contract
Fail to Provide Notice of Lien Waivers

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bo B Croswell

defendant.name: Croswell, Bo B
defendant.address: 420 S High St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bo B Croswell in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Bo B Croswell.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of complaint waived, charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Time period waived. Victim in court, no statement made. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 329319,
Payable Number: 269590,
Receipt Number: 22R 020208,
Amount: $20.00
Signed bond filed with the court.

SHALL NOT SOLICIT ANY HOME IMPROVEMENT WORK UNDER ANY NAME. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.R.T. dob 1-27-1985. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Bo B Croswell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim in court. Defendant will retain an attorney. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Court finds good cause to toll time limits for preliminary hearing. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
